intro: Tetractomia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a robust rhizome system that supports its growth in moist, shaded environments. Its spores are produced on the undersides of the fronds, contributing to its reproductive cycle. Tetractomia philippinensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various organisms.
